description:
With less than two hours to go, [b]the track was getting even wetter by the minute[/b]. [b]The #15 BMW, #99 Proton and #35 Alpine span on separate occasions[/b], losing a notable amount of time and causing Full Course Yellow periods for car retreval, while a few others had smaller exits without consequence. The field was just trying to survive without losing much time in the gravel. [b]The leading #7 Toyota pulled a gap of around 25 seconds over second placed #6 Porsche[/b]. [b]The #8 Toyota, the #20 BMW and the #5 Porsche battled for the last podium position[/b], the BMW even running in parallel with the Toyota after Tosa a couple of times. The #2 Cadillac came alive in the wet and gained several positions, from 12th to 9th.

Now approaching the last hour of the race, [b]the rain was getting lighter[/b] and a dry line started appearing on most of the track. The conditions were good enough that in the last round of pit stops [b]the entire field except for the #51 Ferrari[/b] (still on wets) [b]stopped for slicks[/b]. On cold tyres, the #8 Toyota went through the gravel several times and ended up losing third place to the #6 Porsche. Just minutes later the #2 Cadillac entered pits for a splash-and-dash, and the #51 Ferrari stopped for slick tyres, both losing places in the process.

After the last pit shuffle, with just under 40 minutes to go and still on a damp but drying track, [b]the #7 Toyota had a 10 second gap over the #6 Porsche, but the latter looked faster[/b]. [b]The Ferraris appeared to have the better pace now[/b] and looked to recover positions. [b]Toyotas, Porsches and Ferraris occupied the top 10 except for the #20 BMW and #2 Cadillac[/b], now 6th and 10th respectively. And while all that happened, the #99 Proton had to retire with mechanical issues.
